incident_updates.body:
We are monitoring a mail service disruption caused by an ongoing strike at Canada Post. This disruption is impacting various carriers that offer delivery services in Canada.

As a result, mail and package deliveries in Canada may experience delays until the strike is resolved. Additionally, some carriers may not allow shipment creation at this time.

EasyPost is closely observing the situation and will provide updates as more information becomes available.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Asynchronous flows (including batches) are experiencing processing delays. We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
The USPS Label Broker service is down for maintenance. Service should be restored by 1:00AM ET.
An outage is being investigated with the USPS Label Broker service.
This incident has been resolved.

Lasership API is continuing to experience elevated request timeouts. We are communicating with Lasership and continuing to monitor the performance of the API. Our next update will be at 14:00 PST or sooner.

Lasership API is continuing to experience elevated request timeouts. We are communicating with Lasership and continuing to monitor the performance of the API. Our next update will be at 12:00 PST or sooner.

Lasership API is continuing to experience elevated request timeouts. We are communicating with Lasership and continuing to monitor the performance of the API. Our next update will be at 10:00 PST or sooner.

Lasership API is experiencing elevated request timeouts. Lasership has been notified and our engineers will continue to monitor the performance of the API. Our next update will be at 09:00 PST or sooner.
No further issues have been detected.  This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified the issue and are working to restore service, ETA 15 minutes
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.  Tracking updates are back to normal.
Tracking updates are now occurring on schedule.  The EasyPost team is monitoring to ensure stability.
The EasyPost team has identified an issue causing delays in tracking updates to customers.  We have implemented a fix and service is in the process of normalizing.
USPS Label Purchases have returned to normal, and verified to be stable.

USPS label purchases experienced an increase of HTTP 500 responses for approximately 10 seconds from 18:40:57 to 18:41:07 UTC and reduced service availability, due to a network event. We have observed restoration of normal operation and are monitoring.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented by UPS and response times have returned to normal. We will continue to monitor the performance.
UPS is investigating the performance issues in the UPS APIs.
We are investigating UPS timeout and performance issues.

A fix has been implemented. Some users may see “Refresh Token Invalid - Resetting OAuth Status. You must reauthenticate.” Users who receive this message should re-authenticate and retry their request.

This incident has been resolved.

Engineers have deployed a change to automatically reset the OAuth status of affected accounts when users attempt to rate or buy using those accounts.

Users may see “Refresh Token Invalid - Resetting OAuth Status. You must reauthenticate.” Users who receive this message should re-authenticate and retry their request.

A fix has been put in place for the affected accounts. If you are having issues with any UPS operations, please log into the EasyPost Dashboard and re-authenticate your UPS account. This should resolve any remaining issues.
We have identified an outage affecting all actions for some UPS accounts and are actively working to fix the issue.
The incident has been resolved by UPS
UPS has confirmed that there is a service issue with the UPS API. They are actively working on resolving the issue.
We are investigating performance issues and timeouts affecting UPS shipments.
This incident has been resolved.

Engineers noticed an increase in API error rate between 13:52 and 14:31 PST. Error rates have returned to normal. Engineers are continuing to monitor API performance.

Users should attempt to retry failed API calls.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are seeing a return to normal performance for most customers. A small number of customers continue to be impacted. We are working to fully resolve the remaining issue.
The issue has been identified as an issue on the EasyPost side connecting to UPS. A fix has been made and we are seeing performance improvements.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
The UPS API is experiencing high rates of errors and timeouts for rating, labels, and tracking. UPS has been notified and our engineers will continue to monitor the performance of the UPS API.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified.
We are investigating a service issue affecting UPS, DHL ECS, and webhooks systems.
This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body:
FedEx manifesting has been stable for over 30 minutes. We consider this
incident resolved but will continue to monitor its performance.

FedEx is currently experiencing degraded performance affecting manifesting. Our engineers will continue to monitor the performance of the API. FedEx has been notified and our engineers will continue to monitor the performance of the API. Our next update will be
02:28  UTC (7:28pm PST) or sooner.

incidents.name: UPS Mail Innovations Shipping Label Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue appears to be resolved. We are monitoring to ensure shipping labels are valid.

EasyPost has identified an issue due to a recent UPS change that may temporarily affect some of our users ability to print UPS MI shipping labels. We are communicating with UPS and will provide updates as a fix is released by UPS.
We apologize for the inconvenience.
